alert.note: Alert for Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 21 at 6:29PM CDT until June 21 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR EASTERN DUBUQUE COUNTY... At 628 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Louisburg to near Dubuque Regional Airport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Asbury, Peosta, Centralia, Sageville, Bernard, Zwingle, Durango, Swiss Valley Park, Lock And Dam 11, Key West, Edmore, Dubuque Regional Airport, Fillmore, Mud Lake Park, Rockdale, Mines of Spain, Fillmore Recreation Area, Dubuque County Fairgrounds and Center Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
